definition: rate of movement, an established rate of locomotion
rate of progress, parallel rate of growth or development
an example to be emulated, first place in a competition
rate of performance or delivery : tempo, speed, rhythmic animation : fluency
examples: on pace to set a record
writes with color, with zest, and with pace
… walked slowly, with even, unhesitating pace …

definition: any of various units of distance based on the length of a human step
an exhibition or test of skills or capacities
examples: the trainer put the tiger through its paces

definition: gait, a fast 2-beat gait (as of the horse) in which the legs move in lateral pairs and support the animal alternately on the right and left legs
to walk with often slow or measured tread

examples: could hear him pacing the floor

definition: to set or regulate the pace of, to establish a moderate or steady pace for (oneself)
examples: taught them how to pace their solos for … impact

definition: to go before : precede, to set an example for : lead

examples: Easiness is a virtue in grammar, pace old-fashioned grammarians …
